intro: Meconella kakoethes, commonly known as the Kauai meconella, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Meconella kakoethes is considered a rare and endangered species.
